question.body: Cardiac output is one of the determinants of blood pressure â€“ as cardiac output goes up in a resting individual, blood pressure tends to rise. People with hypertension (high blood pressure) often take medications that slightly decrease their blood volume. By what mechanism does the decrease in blood volume lead to a decrease in cardiac output?

multiple_choice.choice: The decrease in blood volume leads to a decrease in contractility.
The decrease in blood volume leads to a decrease in heart rate.
The decrease in blood volume decreases stroke volume through the Frank-Starling mechanism.

response.feedback: Incorrect. But contractility is mainly affected by the sympathetic nervous system, which only becomes more active with large changes in blood volume.
Incorrect. But heart rate is mainly affected by the sympathetic nervous system, which only becomes more active with large changes in blood volume.

Correct. A decrease in blood volume leads to a decrease in preload (end-diastolic volume). According to the Frank-Starling mechanism, this will lead to a decrease in stroke volume with a corresponding decrease in cardiac output and blood pressure.
